description: Borrowed from Russian кариотип (kariotip), equivalent to karyo- +‎ -type.

entries.meaning: (genetics) The observed characteristics (number, type, shape, etc) of the chromosomes of an individual or species.
(genetics) A record of such characteristics, usually photographic.
(obsolete, genetics) A group of individuals or species that have the same chromosomal characteristics.

verbs.description: karyotype (third-person singular simple present karyotypes, present participle karyotyping, simple past and past participle karyotyped)

entries.meaning: To investigate or record such characteristics
